intro: Lysionotus pauciflorus var. ikedae, commonly known as the Ikedae's star-of-Bethleem, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family, characterized by its trailing growth habit and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded, moist areas within its natural habitat. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and greenhouses.
